questions.question_text: The constant of the cone of a Lambert's chart is 0.80. The angle between the meridian of 30°E and the straight line on the chart from A (30°E, 50°N) to position B is 130° (measure clockwise from the meridian). What is the rhumb line track from A to B?
An aircraft is flying at FL350 with a TAS of 450 kt. The wind is 090°/50 kt. What is the ground speed if the aircraft is heading 090°?
options: A. 400 kt
B. 450 kt
C. 500 kt
D. 550 kt

questions.question_text: The distance between two waypoints is 200 NM. The TAS is 400 kt and the wind component is +50 kt. What is the time enroute in minutes?
The maximum range speed of a jet aircraft is obtained when:
options: A. The ratio of thrust to drag is maximum
B. The ratio of lift to drag is maximum
C. The specific fuel consumption is minimum
D. The drag is minimum

questions.question_text: The Mach number is defined as the ratio of:
options: A. TAS to the speed of sound at sea level
B. TAS to the speed of sound at the flight level
C. CAS to the speed of sound at the flight level
D. EAS to the speed of sound at sea level

questions.question_text: The critical Mach number is the:
options: A. Highest Mach number that can be reached in level flight
B. Mach number at which the aircraft becomes uncontrollable
C. Free stream Mach number at which local sonic speed first occurs on the wing
D. Mach number at which the shock wave reaches the tailplane

questions.question_text: The VOR operates in which frequency band?
options: A. LF
B. MF
C. VHF
D. UHF

questions.question_text: The DME measures:
options: A. Slant range in nautical miles
B. Horizontal distance in nautical miles
C. Height above the DME station in feet
D. Bearing to the DME station in degrees

questions.question_text: The ILS localizer provides:
options: A. Vertical guidance
B. Lateral guidance
C. Distance information
D. Weather information

questions.question_text: The primary purpose of the ADF is to provide:
options: A. Distance to a VOR station
B. Bearing to an NDB station
C. Glidepath information
D. Weather information

questions.question_text: The primary radar in ATC service is used to determine:
options: A. Altitude of aircraft
B. Range and bearing of aircraft
C. Speed of aircraft
D. Type of aircraft

questions.question_text: The secondary surveillance radar (SSR) requires:
options: A. A transponder in the aircraft
B. A DME in the aircraft
C. An ADF in the aircraft
D. A VOR in the aircraft

questions.question_text: The standard pressure setting at the transition altitude is:
options: D. 29.92 inHg

questions.question_text: The QNH is the pressure setting which, when set on the altimeter subscale, will cause the altimeter to read:
options: A. Height above the 1013.25 mb level
B. Altitude above mean sea level
C. Elevation of the airfield
D. Flight level

questions.question_text: The QFE is the pressure setting which, when set on the altimeter subscale, will cause the altimeter to read:
options: A. Zero when the aircraft is on the ground at the airfield
B. The elevation of the airfield when the aircraft is on the ground
C. The height above the airfield when the aircraft is in flight
D. The flight level when the aircraft is in flight

questions.question_text: The transition level is the:
options: A. Altitude at which the altimeter is set to 1013.25 mb on climb
B. Flight level at which the altimeter is set to QNH on descent
C. Lowest flight level available for use above the transition altitude
D. Highest altitude available for use below the transition level

questions.question_text: The term 'clear air turbulence' (CAT) is most commonly associated with:
options: A. Thunderstorms
B. Jet streams
C. Mountain waves
D. Frontal systems

questions.question_text: The tropopause is generally higher at the equator than at the poles because:
options: A. The air is warmer at the equator
B. The air is colder at the equator
C. The pressure is higher at the equator
D. The pressure is lower at the equator

questions.question_text: The jet stream is a:
options: A. Narrow band of strong wind in the upper troposphere
B. Broad area of light and variable winds in the stratosphere
C. Local wind system caused by temperature differences between land and sea
D. Wind system that reverses direction seasonally

questions.question_text: The most common type of icing encountered in flight is:
options: A. Clear ice
B. Rime ice
C. Hoar frost
D. Freezing rain
